description: From Latin aversus, past participle of avertere (“to avert”).

adjectives.description: averse (comparative more averse, superlative most averse)

entries.meaning: Having a repugnance or opposition of mind.
examples: Synonyms: disliking, disinclined, fromward, unwilling, reluctant, loath
The tracks averse a lying notice gave, / And led the searcher backward from the cave.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Lying on the opposite side (to or from).
(heraldry) Turned so as to show the back, as of a right hand.

verbs.description: averse (third-person singular simple present averses, present participle aversing, simple past and past participle aversed)
